But hey, things are getting a bit easier now, thanks to all these government-issued ID cards and docs. Let's dive into the world of identifiers, specifically focusing on the documents that officially scream "This is me!".
normalised: In India, proving who you are can be a real hassle, right? Especially when you're dealing with G-o-v-t. stuff. But hey, things are getting a bit easier now, thanks to all these government issued I-D cards and docs. Let's dive into the world of identifiers, specifically focusing on the documents that officially scream "This is me!".

unnormalised: First off, there's Aadhaar. It's like the king of all IDs here. The UIDAI issues a 12-digit number (e.g., 1234-5678-9012) to every resident, and it’s linked to your biometrics – fingerprints and iris scans. You need it for everything, from opening a bank account at SBI to getting a SIM card. Plus, it's even used to access government subsidies like food rations under the PDS scheme.
normalised: First off, there's Aadhaar. It's like the king of all I-D-s here. The U-I-D-A-I issues a twelve digit number (e.g., one two three four hyphen five six seven eight hyphen nine zero one two) to every resident, and it’s linked to your biometrics – fingerprints and iris scans. You need it for everything, from opening a bank account at S-B-I to getting a S-I-M card. Plus, it's even used to access government subsidies like food rations under the P-D-S scheme.

unnormalised: Next up, we have the good ol' PAN card. Issued by the Income Tax Dept., it's primarily for financial transactions. Every PAN has a 10-character alphanumeric code, like ABCDE1234F. If you're filing your ITR or investing in the stock market, you gotta have one. Forget about dealing with TDS without it!
normalised: Next up, we have the good ol' P-A-N card. Issued by the Income Tax D-e-p-t., it's primarily for financial transactions. Every P-A-N has a ten character alphanumeric code, like A-B-C-D-E one two three four F. If you're filing your I-T-R or investing in the stock market, you gotta have one. Forget about dealing with T-D-S without it!

unnormalised: Then, there’s the Voter ID. This little card lets you vote, obviously! The Election Commission of India issues it, and it has a unique EPIC number, something like XYZ1234567. It's not just for voting; it's also a valid proof of address and identity.
normalised: Then, there’s the Voter I-D. This little card lets you vote, obviously! The Election Commission of India issues it, and it has a unique E-P-I-C number, something like X-Y-Z one two three four five six seven. It's not just for voting; it's also a valid proof of address and identity.

unnormalised: Don't forget the Driving License. It’s issued by the RTO and proves you're legally allowed to drive. It contains personal details and a unique license number, such as DL123456789012345. Useful not only for driving, but as another form of ID!
normalised: Don't forget the Driving License. It’s issued by the R-T-O and proves you're legally allowed to drive. It contains personal details and a unique license number, such as D-L one two three four five six seven eight nine zero one two three four five. Useful not only for driving, but as another form of I-D!

unnormalised: These docs are essential, and keep them safe. Applying is usually pretty simple online through the relevant government portals. Most importantly, having them ready can save a lot of time and stress when doing official work, from banking to getting a new phone connection. So, keep your Aadhaar, PAN, Voter ID, and Driving License handy. It's your Indian ID starter pack!
